label: Quantum Biological Substrate
description: The foundational quantum-physical substrate of the SCPN. It formalizes the mechanisms for sustaining functional, warm-wet quantum coherence via metabolically-driven processes (Fröhlich condensation) and defines the primary interface for the Ψ-field. It serves as the Coherence Backbone for the entire biological architecture.

coreMechanisms.name: Coherence Backbone (MS-QEC)
coreMechanisms.description: A multi-scale quantum error correction architecture, implemented at L1 via topological protection on the microtubule lattice. A large energy gap (Δ ≈ 1.64 eV) protects quantum states from thermal noise (kT ≈ 0.026 eV), ensuring high-fidelity information processing.

coreMechanisms.name: Amplification of Intent (QSR)
coreMechanisms.description: The quantum-to-classical bridge. Mechanisms like Quantum Stochastic Resonance (QSR) demonstrate how a weak, sub-threshold quantum signal (e.g., from the Ψ-field) can be amplified by the system's intrinsic biological noise to produce a definite, macroscopic effect (e.g., neural firing).

coreMechanisms.name: Ψ-Field Stabilization (QZE)
coreMechanisms.description: The active, causal role of the Ψ-field in maintaining coherence. Modeled as a continuous measurement-like interaction (Quantum Zeno Effect), the field projects the substrate back into its coherent subspace, actively suppressing decoherence.

coreMechanisms.name: Information-Geometric Sensing
coreMechanisms.description: The substrate's ability to sense information-geometric properties of its environment, distinct from classical fields. This allows the system to respond to informational complexity (g_FIM) as a fundamental physical quantity.

interfacePoints.description: Provides quantum-filtered symbolic information that modulates neurochemical oscillations and synaptic probabilities.
Bidirectional. Provides a spin-dependent substrate for CISS-based epigenetic modulation and is influenced by long-term state changes in the genomic hardware.
Serves as the coherent backbone and timing signal for the emergence of large-scale, classical tissue-level synchrony (UPDE).

validation.description: Validates the physical plausibility of the L1.M1.QEC mechanism. Confirms that the manuscript's ΔE ≈ 1.64 eV energy gap provides a protection factor sufficient to overcome kT thermal noise, yielding a negligible error threshold p_th.

Validates the L1.M2.Amplification mechanism. Demonstrates that a sub-threshold periodic signal (proxy for Ψ-field) can be successfully amplified by stochastic noise (proxy for biological environment), causing a measurable phase-locking in the system (QSR effect).

Provides the analysis pipeline to validate L1.M4.Sensing. Confirms that a linear regression model can successfully distinguish decoherence caused by 'informational complexity' (g_FIM) from decoherence caused by classical electromagnetic fields (B(t)), confirming the falsifiable prediction of Axiom 2.
